Seal characters (1)

垩字的基本解释

垩
（堊）
è
白土，泛指可用来涂饰的土：白垩（通称“白土子”。亦称“大白”）。
用白土涂饰：垩墙。垩墁。垩室（用白土涂刷的房子，古代孝子在父母去世第十一个月祭于家庙后所居）。

垩字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shèng］
(1)“聖”的俗字。见《明成化说唱词话·花关索认父传》。
(2)“堊”的简化字。
==堊

垩字的康熙字典解释

【丑集中】【土字部】　堊； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页228第29
【廣韻】烏各切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】遏各切，?音惡。色土也。【山海經】大次之山，其陽多堊。【又】蔥聾之山，其中大谷，多白堊，黑靑黃堊。【司馬相如·子虛賦】其土則丹靑赭堊。　又【爾雅·釋宮】牆謂之堊。【釋名】堊者，亞也，次也。先泥之，以灰飾之也。【周禮·春官】守祧若將祭祀，其祧則守祧黝堊之。【註】黝堊其祧，使新潔也。　又不塗塈亦曰堊。【禮·雜記】三年之喪，廬堊室之中。【註】堊室，壘墼爲之，不塗墍也。　又塺泥亦曰堊。【莊子·徐無鬼】郢人堊漫其鼻端若蠅翼，使匠石斲之，運斤成風，盡堊而鼻不傷。　又【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?烏故切，音污。義同。　【正譌】象圬者，縱橫塗飾之形。凡塗飾皆言堊。

垩字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
垩字的起名意思

本义指白色土，可用来粉饰墙壁。后泛指可用来涂饰的各色泥土。

chalk
Basic explanation of words
chalk
(chalk)
è
White clay refers to the soil that can be used for finishing: chalk (commonly known as "baituzi". Also known as "dabai").
Finish with white clay: chalk wall. Chalky. Chalk room (a house painted with white clay, where the ancient filial son lived in the family temple in the eleventh month after the death of his parents).
chalk
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［shèng］
(1) The vulgar word for "Holy". See "Ming Chenghua Talking and Singing Cihua·Huaguan Suo's Father's Biography".
(2) The simplified character of "chalk".
== chalk
chalk
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Ugly Collection] [The Ministry of Soil Characters] 　 Chalk; Kangxi Strokes: 11; Page Number: Page 228 29
[Guang Yun] Wu Geqie [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] [Zheng Yun] To curb each cut, the sound is evil. Color soil also. [Shan Hai Jing] The mountain of the great time, its yang is more chalky. [Also] The mountain of onion and deaf, in which the big valleys are mostly chalky, black and yellow. 【Sima Xiangru·Zixu Fu】The soil is ochre and tan.　[Erya·Shigong] The wall is called chalk. [Release name] Chalk, Yaye, and time. The mud is first, and it is decorated with ashes. 【Zhou Li·Chunguan】If the Shouhu will sacrifice, the other will keep it chalky. [Note] The chalkiness makes Xinjie also clean.　If you don't apply it, you can also say chalk. 【Rite·Miscellaneous】Three years of funeral, in the chaotic chamber. [Note] Chalk room, shack for it, don’t paint shack.　The mud is also called chalk. 【Zhuangzi·Xu Wugui】Ying people filled their noses like flies, so that the carpenter’s stone would make it into a wind, and the nose would be chalky without hurting the nose.　[Ji Yun] [Rhyme] [Zheng Yun]? Wu Gu cut, sound dirty. The same meaning.　【ZhengJiao】Those who are like maids, painted vertically and horizontally. Every finish is chalky.

Old glyph
chalk
Name meaning
The original meaning refers to white soil, which can be used to whitewash walls. Later refers to all kinds of clay that can be used for finishing.
è
1) мел; штукатурка; белила
垩笔 мел, мелок
垩灰 известь, белила
2) белить; штукатурить; белёный (цвет траура); штукатуренный
垩车 белёная повозка (на время траура)
